com.robopupu.api.fsm

Class StateEngine<T_State extends StateEngine>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.robopupu.api.fsm.StateEngine<T_State>
  • Type Parameters:
    T_State - 

    public abstract class StateEngine<T_State extends StateEngine>
extends java.lang.Object
    StateEngine is an abstract class that is used in code generation by annotation processor for creating concrete StateEngine implementations for StateMachines. All concrete state classes are derived from the code generated implemetation of StateEngine.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  StateEngine.Error
      Error defines error types and messages for StateEngine.

      Fields

      protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Class<?>,T_State> mStateCache
      A HashMap used for caching state instances.
      protected T_State mStateEngine
      The reference to an instance of StateEngine that represents a state machine.
      protected java.util.HashSet<T_State> mSubStates
      A HashMap containing either 1) the substates of a state if this instance of StateEngine represents a state or 2) the top-level states if this instance of StateEngine represents a state machine.
      protected T_State mSuperState
      The super state of the state represented by this instance of StateEngine.
      protected java.lang.Class<? extends T_State> mSuperStateClass
      The class of the super state of the state represented by this instance of StateEngine.

      This constructor is to be used by all actual state classes which are extended from the concrete implementation of this StateEngine.

    • Field Detail

      • mSubStates

        protected final java.util.HashSet<T_State extends StateEngine> mSubStates
        A HashMap containing either 1) the substates of a state if this instance of StateEngine represents a state or 2) the top-level states if this instance of StateEngine represents a state machine.

      • mCurrentState

        protected T_State extends StateEngine mCurrentState
        The current state among the substates of this state.

      • mInitialStateClass

        protected java.lang.Class<? extends T_State extends StateEngine> mInitialStateClass
        A Class specifying the initial state among the substates of this state.

      • mStateCache

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Class<?>,T_State extends StateEngine> mStateCache
        A HashMap used for caching state instances. The Classes of states can be used as keys to the HashMap, because each state object has its own Class.

      • mStateEngine

        protected T_State extends StateEngine mStateEngine
        The reference to an instance of StateEngine that represents a state machine. All instances of concrete implementations of StateEngine that represent individual states have a reference to the state machine.

      • mSuperStateClass

        protected java.lang.Class<? extends T_State extends StateEngine> mSuperStateClass
        The class of the super state of the state represented by this instance of StateEngine. If this instance of StateEngine is a state machine, then this field has null value.

      • mSuperState

        protected T_State extends StateEngine mSuperState
        The super state of the state represented by this instance of StateEngine. If this instance of StateEngine is a state machine, then this field has null value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StateEngine

        protected StateEngine(java.lang.Class<? extends T_State> initialStateClass)
        This constructor is to be used by a concrete implementation of StateEngine.
        Parameters:
        initialStateClass - The Class of a state that is the initial state to be entered at top-level when the represented state machine is started.

      • StateEngine

        protected StateEngine(java.lang.Class<? extends T_State> superStateClass,
                      java.lang.Class<? extends T_State> initialStateClass)
        This constructor is to be used by all actual state classes which are extended from the concrete implementation of this StateEngine.
        Parameters:
        superStateClass - The Class of a state that is the super state of the state using this constructor.
        initialStateClass - The Class of a state that is the initial state to be entered at top-level when the represented state machine is started.

        Causes transition from the current state to the specified state.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • transitTo

        protected final T_State transitTo(java.lang.Class<? extends T_State> stateClass,
                                  int entryPoint)
        Causes transition from the current state to the specified state optionally via an entry point
        Parameters:
        stateClass - A Class specifying the target state for the state transition.
        entryPoint - A int value specifying if the optional entry point. Value zero represents a non entry point.
        Returns:
        The current state.

      • toHistoryState

        protected final T_State toHistoryState(java.lang.Class<? extends T_State> stateClass,
                                       boolean deepHistory)
        Causes transition from the current state to the specified history state via a deep or shallow history point.
        Parameters:
        stateClass - A Class specifying the target state for the state transition.
        deepHistory - A boolean value specifying if the state is entered via a deep history point instead of shallow history point.
        Returns:
        The current state.

      • enter

        protected final T_State enter(int entryPoint)
        Enters the represented by this instance of StateEngine. If the state is entered via an entry point the index of the entry point has to be given and it has to be greater than zero.
        Parameters:
        entryPoint - The index of the entry point to be entered. Value zero represents a non entry point.
        Returns:
        The current state.

      • onExit

        protected void onExit()
        Invoked by exit(StateEngine).

      • onEnter

        protected void onEnter()
        Invoked by enter(int).

      • enterEntryPoint

        protected T_State enterEntryPoint(int entryPoint)
        Enters the specified entry point. If a state implementation has one or more entry points, it has to override this method.
        Parameters:
        entryPoint - The index of the entry point to be entered.
        Returns:
        The current state after entering the deep history point.

      • enterDeepHistory

        protected final T_State enterDeepHistory()
        Enters a deep history point.
        Returns:
        The current state after entering the deep history point.

      • enterShallowHistory

        protected final T_State enterShallowHistory()
        Enters a shallow history point.
        Returns:
        The current state after entering the shallow history point.

      • exit

        protected final void exit(T_State newState)
        Invoked to exit the state represented by this instance of StateEngine. The state machine will enter the given new target state.
        Parameters:
        newState - A new target state.

      • onError

        protected final void onError(T_State state,
                             StateEngine.Error error)
        Invoked when the specified error has occurred while in the given state.
        Parameters:
        state - A state object.
        error - An StateEngine.Error value specifying the occurred error.

      • onError

        protected final void onError(T_State state,
                             StateEngine.Error error,
                             java.lang.String eventName)
        /** Invoked when the specified error has occurred while in the named event has been received in the given state.
        Parameters:
        state - A state object.
        error - An StateEngine.Error value specifying the occurred error.
        eventName - The name of an event.

      • onDisposeStateEngine

        protected void onDisposeStateEngine()
        Invoked by dispose() for an instance of StateEngine that represents a state machine.

      • onDisposeState

        protected void onDisposeState()
        Invoked by dispose() for an instance of StateEngine that represents a state of a state machine.

      • dispose

        protected final void dispose()
        Disposes this StateEngine and the all state objects contained by it. The method is recursively invoked to all substates of a each state.

      • start

        public final void start()
        Starts this StateEngine. When started, the top-level initial state is entered.

      • reset

        public final void reset()
        Resets this StateEngine. Resetting clear the cache of state machines. A state machine has to be started again after resetting.

      • stop

        public final void stop()
        Stops this StateEngine. Stopping causes the state machine and all of its state to be disposed.

      • isSuperState

        public final boolean isSuperState(T_State state)
        Tests if the given state object is a direct or an indirect super state of the state represented by this instance of StateEngine.
        Parameters:
        state - A state object to be tested.
        Returns:
        A boolean value.

      • isSuperStateFor

        protected final boolean isSuperStateFor(T_State state)
        Tests if the state object represented by this instance of StateEngine is a direct or an indirect super state of the given state.
        Parameters:
        state - A state object to be tested.
        Returns:
        A boolean value.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A String representation of this StateEngine is simply the name of the class implementing abstract class StateEngine.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String
